title: Three people injured in shooting at Etobicoke public housing complex
content:
Police are shown at the scene of a shooting on Scarlettwood Court early Saturday morning. 

Chris Fox, CP24.com 

Last Updated Saturday, September 26, 2015 7:35AM EDT 

Three men were taken to hospital, one of them in life-threatening condition, after shots rang out at a public housing complex in Etobicoke early Saturday morning. 

It happened behind a TCHC townhome on Scarlettwood Court near Scarlett Road and Lawrence Avenue at around 1:45 a.m. 

Police say the victim who was taken to hospital in life-threatening condition is undergoing emergency surgery. The other two victims were transported to hospital with serious and minor injuries, respectively. 

Police say that they believe one of the victims was caught in the crossfire. 

No arrests have been made and no suspect description has been released. . 

Forensic investigators are on scene.
